Information expansion: Chinese coded characters
1 This document specifies the sixteen-digit representation of Chinese characters and even two-digit coding for information technology.
This document is applicable to the processing of information in Chinese and other text graphics characters, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output.

This document applies to technical products for the information processing and exchange of Chinese and other text graphics characters, including but not limited to software products represented by input typing, optical character recognition (OCR), editing, proofreading, transliteration, speech synthesis, text transcription, and writing, as well as convenience products represented by computers, communication terminals, e-books, reading machines, etc.

5 Overall structure
The representation of ordinary numbers preceded by 0x in the correct text is in the hexadecimal system, and the representation of unmarked 0x in the correct text is in the decimal system.
The ordinary encoded representations in the appendix are all in the hexadecimal system, and the representations of other numbers are all in the decimal system.
The single-byte part uses the GB/T 11383 1989 encoding structure, making it use the 0x00~0x7F code bit.
The two-letter part uses two eight-digit binary bit strings to represent a character, whose first digit is 0x81 1 0xFE, and the last digit is 0x40 1 0x7E and 0x80 1 0xFE.

Summary of the report
The impact of coronavirus pneumonia on the drug market
The impact could be similar to the 2008 economic crisis
The global outbreak of novel coronavirus pneumonia has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, the disease has left healthcare institutions struggling to cope, and nearly collapsed, and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused serious disruption to the global economy.
The impact of the epidemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it is likely to have far-reaching implications.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to manufacture drugs because restrictions on movement also limit the availability of precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers may have to find new routes and methods because of travel restrictions and are unable to cross the border.
The patterns of drug use and supply may change, and the government's ability to respond may be hampered.
The transformation brought about by the new coronavirus pneumonia is unprecedented, but some lessons can be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug addicts began to look for cheaper synthetic substances, switching to injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments have cut drug-related budgets.
If governments respond in the same way to the current economic downturn, interventions such as prevention of drug use and related risky behaviours and drug treatment services could be hit hard.
In addition, the priority of interception and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to act.
Some countries have large quantities of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and it is expected that drug trafficking in these countries will be directly affected the most.

Messengers carry synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine in their carry-on bags or hidden in their personal luggage, sometimes in large quantities. Due to restrictions on air travel in almost all places, the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs may be completely suspended.
Although international postal services have also been disrupted, there may be an increase in trafficking activities using the dark web and freight mail.
In the long run, the economic downturn and related lockdowns may disrupt the drug market.

With rising unemployment and lack of opportunity, poor and vulnerable people are more likely to use drugs in harmful ways, develop drug addiction and turn to illegal activities related to drugs, whether they are produced or transported.
Drug trafficking groups may take advantage of this situation to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to strengthen their ranks.
As the government's ability to respond decreases, these changes may quickly take root and become a new reality in many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Growth in the market
Population growth patterns partly explain why the market is expanding
Drug use around the world has been on the rise, both in terms of overall numbers and in terms of the proportion of drug users in the world's population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, and in 2018, it was estimated that there were 269 million drug users, accounting for 5.3% of the global population.
Over the past two decades, the rate of increase in drug abuse in developing countries has been much faster than in developed countries.

This reflects to some extent the difference in overall population growth over this period, which was 7% in developed countries and 28% in developing countries, but also reflects the faster growth in developing countries in the light years.
Adolescents and young adults account for the largest proportion of drug users.
In the period 2000-2018, the population of this age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while the population of this age group in developed countries decreased by 10%.
Urbanization is a driver of the current and future drug market
Drug use is more prevalent in urban areas than in rural areas, whether in developed or developing countries.

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the large-scale migration of people from rural to urban areas. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared with 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, especially in developing countries where urbanization trends are more prominent.

Increased wealth is associated with increased drug use, but the disease is most prevalent among the poorest people in the world, and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries.
Drugs such as cocaine are more closely linked to the richer regions of the world.
Similarly, in the interior of each country, the prevalence of drug use is higher among the wealthy.
But the higher rate of drug addiction is in people with lower socioeconomic status.
Data from a few countries show a link between harmful patterns of drug use and disease and low income.
These patterns seem to be less common in the wealthier social classes.
The economic constraints caused by the global coronavirus pneumonia crisis are likely to increase the risk to the most vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment rates, have been linked to an increase in drug abuse in the past, and the epidemic has forced millions of people around the world to lose their jobs.

The coronavirus pandemic, which could lead to a further expansion of the drug market, could lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illegal cultivation of species, or because of a decrease in the control capacity of national authorities, or because more people may have to take risks and engage in illegal activities in the context of an economic crisis.

The restrictions associated with the novel coronavirus have led to a decrease in air and land traffic, which may have increased maritime trafficking, and the risk of interception at sea is low, and there is more smuggling by air or land.
Recent reports indicate that cocaine cargo is being transported directly from South America by sea to Europe.
Increased complexity
The emergence of non-internationally controlled substances is stable, but new types of opioids with potential dangers are increasing the market for drugs and becoming more complex.

In addition to cannabis, cocaine, and plant-based substances such as heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added, many of which are not under international control, and the non-medical use of drugs is also growing rapidly.
The domestic market of member countries has about 500 new active substances per year.
Currently, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
Although the total amount of the new psychoactive substance has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
Of the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, opioid-type new psychoactive substances accounted for only 2%, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.

Many of the new opioid psychoactive substances are similar to fentanyl, and their efficacy and harm have been proven to cause overdose deaths in North America, and in other areas, but to a lesser extent.
In North America, fentanyl is used as a mixture for heroin and other drugs, including cocaine and methamphetamine, and as a counterfeit opioid.

Some evidence suggests that new psychoactive substances are also injected into Europe: a study of waste syringe residues in six European cities found that many syringes contained new psychoactive substances that produced an excitatory effect.
The use of new psychoactive substances may become increasingly entrenched in the underprivileged
A single new type of psychoactive substance has hardly ever formed a large market.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabis is a serious problem among marginalized groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
Twenty-two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, most of which identified synthetic cannabis as the main challenge.

Controls on precursor chemicals have forced drugmakers to innovate, and many chemicals commonly used as precursors to synthesize drugs such as benzodiazepines, methylphenidate, and acetaminophen have been placed under international control.
Drug dealers and drugmakers have been looking for alternatives to not only more regulated substances, but also chemicals designed to evade regulation, the so-called "spectacular precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at preventing the spread of novel coronavirus pneumonia are likely to further squeeze out poisoners who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this has already become a reality: in March 2020, it was reported that a shortage of methylphenidate precursors imported from East Asia led to a rise in methylphenidate prices in Mexico and the United States.
The market is changing.
Synthetic drugs replace opioids in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The opioid market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The number of opioids seized by Russian federal authorities has decreased by about 80%, while the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has decreased significantly.
But the market for stimulants seems to be booming.
There is evidence that methylphenidate and various carcidians, including methylphenidate and a-methylphenidate, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities report that the number of secret processing sites for the manufacture of various illegal drugs recently seized has increased dramatically, doubling in two years to 152 in 2018.
Growth in the methamphetamine market in Afghanistan and Iraq
As early as 2012, investigations of hospital, prison and other institutional personnel revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystalline methylphenidate has become another major drug of concern in addition to fentanyl and quimper.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with drug users saying that cannabis is harder to obtain than fentanyl or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methylphenidate processing sites, and the Narcotics Control Bureau has expressed concern about the large-scale import of counterfeit methylphenidate preparations, and the use of these preparations as precursors.
In Afghanistan, methylphenidate production appears to have begun in 2014.
Since then, methylphenidate amide has been steadily increasing in quantity.
However, the catch of squid in the first half of 2019 was 1.657 kg, a significant increase compared to the previous year.
The large-scale seizure of methylphenidate, believed to have originated in Afghanistan, in other countries also indicates that production in the country is rising rapidly.
Policy changes and trends
Most of the jurisdictions that have legalized non-medical cannabis use have an increasing trend of cannabis use.
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay, and the United States allow the manufacture of cannabis products for non-medical use.
In most of these jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical use of cannabis.

In the two states that first passed the legislation, Colorado and Washington, the use of cannabis by adults for non-medical purposes has increased, especially in the past month, and daily or almost daily use has increased, exceeding the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that cannabis use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, almost doubling in the last month.
This indicates that the main reason for the increase is the frequent and frequent use of cannabis.
Short-term data from Canada also shows that while the legal market expanded in 2018 and 2019, the use of cannabis is also increasing.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained certain products from illegal sources.
Is the legalization of cannabis behind the global decline in cannabis seizures?
In 2018, global cannabis harvests fell to their lowest level in 20 years, due to a decline in North America, where cannabis harvests have fallen 84% in the past decade.

In comparison, the pattern of almost double-digit cannabis catches in other parts of the world during the same period suggests that policies aimed at unlocking the cannabis market played a key role in the decline.
The regulation of new psychoactive substances seems to have a deterrent effect. The regulatory effect of new psychoactive substances in the country is still difficult to assess.
Some countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances show different prevalence rates of new psychoactive substances use.
In some other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after the adoption of domestic legislation.
Opioids, a medication used for pain management and sedation, are unevenly distributed in high-income countries.
In 2018, more than 90% of all medicinal opiates available for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
About 50% are in North America, 40% are in Europe, and 2% are in Oceania.
These countries account for about 12% of the world's population.
It is estimated that low- and middle-income countries account for 88% of the world's population, but less than 10% of the world's population consumes pharmaceutical opiates.
Barriers to accessing opioids are related to many factors, including legislation, culture, health systems, and prescribing practices.
The poorest people are at greater risk of drug addiction, with about 35.6 million people suffering from drug addiction in 2018.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of drug addiction and exacerbate its consequences. Research in high-income countries has confirmed this. In these studies, the adverse socioeconomic trajectory of individuals is not only related to their condition at a certain point in time, but also to the risk of drug addiction.

Drug addiction also exacerbates socioeconomic disadvantage, further increasing the risk of unemployment, poverty and homelessness, thereby fostering a vicious cycle of disadvantage. These outcomes may also be related to the humiliating attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities and immigrants, people of diverse sexual orientation, people displaced by armed conflict or disaster, and people in rural settings may also be overwhelmed by drug addiction or have problems accessing treatment services.

According to the Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) indicator, which estimates the number of healthy life years lost due to disability and premature death, the harmful effects of drug use on a broader range of societies have increased over the past decade.
Between 2007 and 2018, the global disability-adjusted life expectancy due to drug use increased by 17% <unk>
The disability-related adjusted life expectancy for liver cancer caused by untreated hepatitis C, which is common in injecting drug users, increased by a particularly high rate, reaching 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is complex and it is difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychoactive substances and violence.
Limited data from a global scale suggests that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide.
But alcohol seems to play a bigger role in violent incidents than drugs.

While drug use can lead to crime, in some cases, this association can be attributed in part to a variety of mediating factors, such as socioeconomic disadvantage and other types of adversity caused by personal risk, family environment, and peer influence.
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, large-scale organized crime, including international drug trafficking, is likely to be carried out in a non-violent context.

In the short term, the existence and extent of violence depends not so much on the number of trafficking, but on certain changes that destabilize the balance of power between organized crime groups, such as changes in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of well-known criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group over another.
Recent trends
Cannabis is the most commonly used substance, with opioids being the most harmful.
It is estimated that 1.92 billion people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most used drug in the world.
In comparison, 58 million people used opiates in 2018.
But the associated dangers of opioids are ignored due to the low number of users.

Of the estimated 167,000 deaths related to drug use disorders in 2017, 66% were caused by these substances, and of the 21 million years of life lost to disability or premature death believed to be caused by drug use, 50% were caused by these substances.
Non-medical use of synthetic opioids exacerbates public health crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the opioid crisis is exacerbated by cocaine; in North America, by fentanyl. These two regions have little in common in terms of economic, demographic, or general drug use patterns, but are struggling to combat the opioid crisis fueled by readily available and inexpensive drugs.
In North America, the use of synthetic opioids such as fentanyl has led to an increase in opioid overdose deaths over the past 20 years.
In 2018, of the 67,367 overdose deaths reported in the United States, two-thirds involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Part of the reason for fentanyl overdose deaths is the unpredictability of fentanyl in the illicit drug market.
In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the market for non-medical use of quinoa has grown significantly.
In the region, more and more patients are receiving treatment for the disease using quimby.
In 2017, the number of global seizures of rhino sharks increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law to regulate the sport of wrestling, global whaling dropped to 32 percent.
The crisis is due to the simplicity of manufacture and low production costs, as well as the lack of international regulation of Quimard and many fentanyl analogues or their precursors.
Compounding the crisis is the availability of these substances in both the pharmaceutical and illicit markets, making them more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse.
Increased use of stimulants
The stimulant sector is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, both of which are on the rise in their main markets.
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, as cocaine became popular in North America and Western Europe.
About 27 million people used benzodiazepines in the same year, of which methylbenzodiazepines were the most used benzodiazepines in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most indicators available, the use of methylphenidate has been increasing in these two regions for the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes alternating, so that when the use of one drug increases, the use of the other decreases, sometimes increasing and decreasing simultaneously to meet the demand of the same market.
New coronavirus pneumonia increases the risk of injecting drug users
It is estimated that about 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018, and about 10% of global HIV infections were caused by injecting drugs.
More than 1 million people infected with HIV from injecting drug users, and 5.5 million people infected with hepatitis C.
In 2017, about 5.85 million people died from drug use, half of them from hepatitis C-induced liver disease, and injection drug users' hepatitis C is still largely untreated.

Opioid shortages caused by restrictions on novel coronavirus pneumonia may lead users to substitute alcohol or more readily available substances such as benzodiazepines, or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs.
As some users switch to injection or more frequent injection, more harmful uses may occur.

EU summit debates on refugee policy, EU officials: the reception process is a step-by-step bottle - China New Network
EU summit debates on refugee policy, EU officials: bottles at every step of the reception process

The head of the European Commission, Jean-Claude Juncker, told reporters in Brussels on February 10 that the European Union leaders had agreed to a tougher policy on illegal immigration, making it easier to deport illegal immigrants.
The EU's move is reportedly in response to growing concerns about illegal immigration in Europe, where the core problem is that few illegal immigrants are ultimately repatriated.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the committee to "immediately mobilize substantial EU funds" to strengthen the external borders through infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been arguing over the issue of paying for the fence.
Delaney has repeatedly stated that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But diplomats from some member states say that if the EU were to share the cost of installing cameras, towers and other infrastructure along the external borders, this would give each country a boost in its national budget and speed up construction.

Euractiv says EU officials acknowledge that there are bottlenecks at every step of the refugee reception process, that limited reception capacity and the overwhelming migration authorities of member states cannot stop refugees from submitting countless asylum applications in EU countries, and that the EU's refugee reception system is in a near-permanent crisis.
The European Commission estimates that the EU's Schengen countries received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, almost half as many as the previous year.
At the same time, the European Union recorded more than 330,000 illegal entries last year.
In this context, the summit also agreed on a "principle" that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants based on a court ruling in another member state.
In addition, the report says that EU leaders have also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of a safe country", which will pave the way for the EU to develop a common list.
(Source: Global Times) Written by the author of the book.
U.S. upgrades lithium chip wars and re-creates global semiconductor industry - China New Network

Recently, the U.S. has been under pressure from the Netherlands and Japan to agree to start export controls on Chinese semiconductor manufacturing facilities, and foreign media reports that the U.S. government is considering cutting all ties between U.S. suppliers and Huawei, banning U.S. suppliers from supplying any products to Huawei.

In recent years, the United States has been attacking China's development of semiconductor cores, precisely pressuring China's semiconductor production and supply, building the China Semiconductor Industry Association, and plotting to thoroughly dismantle China's advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it's the establishment of a "technological alliance" between South Korea and South Korea, or the establishment of a "quadrilateral alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan in China, or the establishment of a "small circle" of semiconductor industries through mechanisms such as the US-Japan-India-Australia Quadrilateral Mechanism and the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework, the United States is introducing the semiconductor industry through the means of politicization, camp-weaponization, and attempting to build a closed supply chain to supplement its manufacturing of chips.
However, the U.S. flag-bearer's tactics against the Chinese were also "wounding the enemy by a thousand self-destruction eight hundred times".

Recently, Pan Lin Group, a well-known U.S. chip manufacturing equipment supplier, announced that it would lay off 1,300 full-time employees and 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters due to the latest round of export bans on Chinese chip manufacturing equipment.
Global optical engraver giant Dutch Asme Holdings recently warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China could lead to higher semiconductor prices.

According to US media analysis, after the US government's crackdown on industries such as Chinese chips and semiconductors, many US companies suffered, including developers of electronic design automation tools, chip designers, manufacturers of crystal manufacturing equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The United States so-called suppressed China's advanced semiconductor industry, but dragged down the global semiconductor industry supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry that has long formed a closely linked global semiconductor industry.

According to experts, based on the professional division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross the borders of more than 70 countries, the entire journey reaching 100 days.

Although the semiconductor industry in the United States has a strong base, its manufacturing capacity is particularly weak in advanced manufacturing processes, and it is heavily dependent on East Asia.

Even though the United States is trying to steer the supply of advanced chips towards a U.S.-led "small circle" regionalization, the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor industry is difficult to change.
The United States is strongly reshaping the semiconductor industry in China, re-creating the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the global future industry, and the development of the chip industry is inseparable from the joint participation of countries around the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively passing the Innovation and Competition Act, the 2022 U.S. Competition Act, the Chip and Science Act, using its technological supremacy to consolidate its technological leadership, and pushing its allies, such as Intel, Envi, and Samsung, to go to the U.S. to manufacture chips.
In the short term, the U.S. has indeed caused trouble for China's chip industry and related industry development, reaping real benefits.

But in the long run, the U.S. hysterically suppresses and pushes China's chip industry to break through, losing the huge Chinese market, and ultimately greatly weakens the innovative will and innovation capacity of U.S. tech companies, damaging the development of the global chip industry.

The first batch of personal care products goes on sale
The company's seven products are available for purchase, with a minimum of 360 days.
Personal retirement financial products finally launched

On February 10, China Finance Network released the first list of personal pensioners' financial products, and seven personal pensioners' financial products from the Workers' Bank, the Agricultural Bank, and the China Post were officially launched.
So far, the shelves of personal pension funds have finally gathered the four products of personal pension savings, personal pension finances, personal pension insurance, and personal pension fund.

The first batch of personal pension financial products are all publicly traded net-worth open-ended products, of which five new products are survival products, two are mixed products, and the remaining six are fixed income products.

The report also noted that four of the five new products are from the Industrial and Financial Bank of China (IFC), all of which are fixed income products with shortest holding periods of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days and 1080 days, and corresponding performance comparison benchmarks (annual) of 3.70% - 4.20% - 4.10% - 4.60% - 4.40% - 4.90% - 5.25% - 5.75%.

The remaining new product is the shortest-term holding of the company's fixed income product, the "Shields of the Post Office" (Shields of the Post Office) and the "Shields of the Post Office" (Shields of the Post Office).

One of the two surviving products is the Agricultural Bank of Finance, Agricultural Bank of Finance, and the 360 Days of Technology Innovation RMB of Finance products, which are of a mixed nature and have a risk rating of 3.

The other surviving product is the shortest-term holding of the fixed income type, the 365-day fixed income type, which began recruitment on December 30 last year and officially operated on January 4 this year, with a cumulative net worth of 1.0011 on February 8.

According to the opinion of the State Council Office on the promotion of the Golden Hair Exhibition for Personal Retirement, personal pension funds, financial products that can be invested in include banking, savings, savings, commercial pension insurance, public fundraising, etc.
The first batch of personal pension products were launched, with the logo that personal pension investors can officially buy personal pension products through personal pension funds.
In November last year, the Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission (BRSC) developed a temporary method for the management of personal pension funds in commercial banks and financial institutions.

The rules stipulate that participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, personal pension fund products, and other personal pension products through their personal pension fund accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources, the Ministry of Finance, and the National Tax Administration issued notices to implement the system in 36 pioneering cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, and Hebei.
As of the end of 2022, there were 19,450,000 people participating in personal pension schemes, 6,130,000 people paying contributions, and a total of 14,2 billion yuan.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot only launched three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products and personal pension fund.
Now that personal pension and financial products have come together, how should investors choose?

Experts from the Department of Research and Development of Banking and Financial Products said that compared to other personal pension products, pension products and personal pension products have three characteristics.
One is stability, a more robust risk management mechanism, a more robust investment strategy and philosophy, and the implementation of independent third-party trust for non-mother banks.

The second is long-term, the probationary stage of retirement financial products are all 5 years and above, the next step is the release of personal retirement financial products, the minimum holding period is basically 1 year, encouraging holding for more than 3 years.

The third is universal, the product purchase threshold is low, the starting point is generally 1 yuan, some are as low as 0.01 yuan, the cost of custody, management and other costs of the product are more affordable.
Experts point out that investors should make choices based on product characteristics and their own risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have a longer term, higher interest rate, higher security characteristics, suitable for people with low risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products are more suitable for people who are unable to bear investment risks, can accept stable returns; while personal pension financial products and public fund products do not guarantee capital or returns, have a certain investment risk, but higher expected returns, suitable for people with a certain financial knowledge and risk tolerance.

Fitness should be rid of the trust crisis - China New Network
Another big gym with thunderstorms?
Recently, the issue of the maintenance of members of well-known fitness institutions has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally, and later, rumors of the institution's closure caused panic among members, leading to the intervention of the Public Security Department.
Finally, the agency's responsible people responded, promising to work hard to protect the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the storm was calmed down.

Some stores of individual fitness institutions have had operational problems, temporarily closed, consumers would have been calm and waiting for the problem to be solved, so why is the first reaction of many members "it's not a big deal"?
Behind the fitness club membership protection storm, there is a deep-seated crisis of industry trust.
Traditional gyms in the country generally adopt a prepaid model, earning money that users do not come, is the underlying logic of its development.
Obtaining cash flow through pre-sale membership cards, continuously opening new stores, seemingly able to cycle back and forth, in fact, can't form a stable profit model.
Negative information about industries such as gyms and running tracks is frequently circulated, causing a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From a market perspective, gyms are, of course, a good business with a lot of money.
The gymnasium has had its ups and downs, but has always been the focus of capital.
Multiple data show that the heat in areas such as literary consumption continues to rise, and the market continues to warm up.

Specific to the fitness market, with the steady improvement of the living standards of the residents, the idea of a healthy life is deeply ingrained in people's hearts, and the development of the fitness industry has a lot to do.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to focus on quality development.

However, individual institutions are blindly optimistic about the recovery of the fitness market, just emerged from the crisis, and sounded the alarm bell of the land reclamation of Khejiang, investing a brain in the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in recent years, many institutions have been affected by the epidemic, many institutions have withdrawn, the industry has been rebranded, and companies with real power have selectively increased their acquisition efforts, rearranged their layout, and not tried new opportunities.
However, if the fitness market is to enter a virtuous cycle, the industry must change its traditional model and change its operating strategy.
Only by steadily building consumer trust and security can we truly win the market and win the future.
Compared to the construction of new stores to occupy the market, the fitness industry currently needs more to focus on optimizing services, using high-quality development to stabilize users.
First of all, to retain users through services.
Gyms belong to the service industry, its essence is to adhere to "user-oriented", to closely surround the needs of users, to focus on improving the quality of services.
Secondly, to improve the user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the current popular Internet gym model, which allows users to pay by the hour and choose their own venue.
At the same time, physical data and sports data can be used effectively, and social needs can be met, realizing a complete service loop from online to offline.
There is no private marketing, no prepaid year cards, users' concerns about fitness institutions and running are reduced, and trust is enhanced.
In addition, we need to actively explore the diversity of business models.

Nowadays, sports consumption has moved from a single service to a scene consumption, fitness clubs are expected to become a new entrance to consumption, surrounding sports supplies and fitness equipment, etc. Peripheral products may become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choice.

Nanjing real estate market to compensate for the difference in prices - China New Network

In an interview with the Yangtze Evening News on the 10th, the reporter of the Purple Bull News found that the price-for-service agreement, which had not been seen for more than a decade, was again back in the Nanjing real estate market, and a building in the Jiangbei New Area announced that it would compensate for the difference in price, and the offer of other housing sources was greater than the previous discount.
There are many conditions for price negotiations.
The building, located in the new district of Jiangbei, is called the Pauly Yangtze Cloud, and Mr. Sun told reporters that he found a statement on the roof last weekend.

The developer of the building promises that anyone who purchases a property between February 1 and February 28 will be able to exchange the property for the buyer from the date of the contract of sale to the date of the delivery of the property, and if the discount on other properties in the project is greater than the discount on the previous purchase of the property (except for the commercial property belonging to the same type of apartment, the same building, the same unit, the same property type).

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this is actually a "price guarantee agreement", the purpose is to make the buyer feel safe, not to worry about developing corporate price reduction promotion, now if you are afraid to buy it, it will be cheaper, go to the sales office, there is no time, if not, it will be really annoying.
Many home buyers believe that the price guarantee agreement, although it gives home buyers a sense of security, is not low.

Ms. Zheng, who plans to buy a luxury apartment in Jiangbei, says that the price guarantee is first of all to have the same type of apartment, but also to live in the same building and the same unit, so the buyer can compare the price of the apartment with the price of the apartment, so the door is still high.
Some home buyers also believe that due to the asymmetry of information, the difficulty of giving extra concessions and maintaining the rights of the buyer is not small when selling.
It remains to be seen whether the buyers will be able to stay.

The reporters found out on Nanjing Real Estate that the building was sold in November last year for a total of 252 units of the first two floors, with a total area of 105 square meters, 114 square meters, 129 square meters, etc. The average price of the renovation was 39843 yuan per square meter.

However, more than two months ago, online real estate showed that the total number of unsold units on the floor was 157, accounting for 62.3% of the total, of which the 8th floor had 128 units, the number of unsold units reached 113, and 44 of the 124 units on the 7th floor were also unsold, the total number of completed units was only 33, accounting for only 13%.
Market sources introduce that the "price-preservation agreement" also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, in order to attract the attention of home buyers, the building across the Huangshan Road in Hsinchu launched a "price guarantee program", specifically for the company's commitment that if the project's discount expands within a year, the difference generated by this will be returned to the owner according to the difference.
After this, in April 2011, nine floors in Nanjing were also sold out, with some of the sources promising to compensate for the difference in price.
The housing market is warming up, and we need a needle to boost our spirits.
Mr. Shen, a senior operator in the real estate industry in Nanjing, said that the price guarantee agreement is also one of the marketing methods of real estate companies.
He believes that developing companies now need more confidence than home buyers, and the introduction of the "guarantee price agreement" is actually a boost to them.
As for whether to keep home buyers, he said that this depends on the impact of multiple factors such as regulatory policies, loan gates, etc. It remains to be seen.
Multiple data recessions: Taiwan's economy starts the year badly - China New Network
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) has seen a three-digit decline in the last seven months, and the Taiwanese authorities have recently continued to release economic data for January 2023.
Experts analyze that Taiwan's economy started the year with poor performance and considerable growth pressure.
According to the Taiwanese Ministry of Finance, Taiwan's exports in January this year amounted to $315.1 billion, a year-on-year decrease of 21.2%, the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export volume of 11 main export commodities declined compared to the same period last year.
The largest declines were in the optical equipment of rubber and its products, with an annual decrease of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Exports of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decrease in 11 years.
Of these, integrated circuits decreased by 18.3% year-on-year, marking the biggest decline in 14 years.

According to the head of the department's statistics department, Yang Mina, this shows that the weakening of demand in the consumer electronics industry has spread, and the electronics industry has entered a correction period.
Statistics show that imports and exports from Taiwan region doubled in January, exceeding only $23.4 billion, the lowest level in nearly three years.

The Taiwanese authorities' financial affairs department believes that global end-end demand has decreased, industry adjustment stocks have suppressed manufacturers' willingness to buy, exports have deteriorated in the short term, and Taiwan's export recession in the first quarter of this year is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the China Institute of Economic Research in Taiwan, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) in January this year was 40.4 percent after seasonal adjustment, down 3.3 percentage points from December last year, and tightened for seven consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring indicator system, the PMI is 50% as a dried line, the index is greater than 50%, representing an expansion of the economy, and vice versa.
January Taiwan PMI five-component indicator, new orders, production and manpower contraction, supplier delivery time decrease, inventory contraction

The six largest industries reported the full PMI tightening, with the electricity and mechanical equipment industries (35.1%) the electronics and optics industry (35.2%) the chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%) the basic raw materials industry (42.4%) the transportation industry (42.6%) and the food and textile industry (45.7%) ranking.

In terms of prices, the Taiwanese authorities and the General Accounting Office announced that Taiwan's CPI annual growth rate was 3.04 percent in January this year, and has again broken the 3% mark since July last year.
Among them, vegetable prices jumped 28.25%, setting a new 17-month high.

Cao Zhihong, a special commissioner of the General Administration of the People's Republic of China, said that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed above expectations, excluding the Spring Festival factor, and the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% of last December, and the inflation pressure is still present and still high.
Experts are pessimistic about the outlook for Taiwan's economy this year, according to reports from local media such as the Combined Press, Yahoo Finance, and others.

Wu Da-ren, a professor at the Department of Economics at Taichung Central University, analyzes that the export recession may cause problems with the cash flow of export manufacturing manufacturers, and the risk of debt default increases.
At the same time, the decrease in orders led to manufacturers cutting labor costs, affecting the labor market and the family economy, which in turn impacted consumption capacity.

According to Taiwan Institute of Economic Research researcher Yang Da-sheng, the situation of the EU-US trade war has not been resolved this year, demand continues to shrink, and it is expected that the recession in Taiwan's exports will continue until the first half of the year.
As Taiwan's economy is supported by exports and affected by the export downturn, the year-round economic growth performance will be worse than last year.

Henan Province regulates the price of integrated oral implantation medical services
Central Television News: Dental implants are the ideal choice for many toothless patients, but the price of one million yuan has been so high that many patients have been looking forward to it.

"After the new policy, the doctor told me that this situation is almost 8,000 yuan or less than 10,000 yuan, basically saving half of it.

On the basis of the current project, Henan Province also integrated 15 oral implantation medical service pricing projects such as single implantation fees, and unified the pricing and insurance payment categories of provincial public health institutions, and canceled or adjusted 20 medical service pricing projects such as dental implantation.

The head of the Zhengzhou City Health Insurance Bureau's pharmaceutical price and bidding department, Li Yunjie, said that the main beneficiaries are the four parties, one is health insurance, health insurance spending is less; the hospital's occupancy is less, patients will increase appropriately; for the supplier, there is a market; for us, the patient is the most profitable party, the cost of a tooth transplant may be halved or even more.

The Biden administration blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the balloon project on Friday.

The U.S. Commerce Department said the five Chinese companies and one research institute helped modernize China's military, especially in aerospace projects, including flying boats and aircraft carriers.
It is difficult for companies on the blacklist to obtain U.S. technology exports.

The list is called the "Entity List" and companies on the list will not be able to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain a special export permit from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The companies included in the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjing Sky Technology Co., Ltd., China Electronic Technology Group's 48th Institute, Dongguan Ling Air Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., Hawk Gate Aviation Technology Group, Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. and Shanxi Hawk Gate Aviation Technology Group, Ltd.
Prior to this, the White House said it was considering more broad measures to "discover and address China's larger-scale surveillance activities that threaten U.S. national security".
The balloon incident further escalated tensions between China and the United States, and U.S. Secretary of State Blinken canceled his visit to China.

The U.S. dropped the balloon on February 4, and the Chinese government made a serious intervention in the U.S. Embassy in China, criticizing the U.S. for seriously impacting and damaging the efforts and progress of the two sides to stabilize China-U.S. relations.

Based on the evidence of the wreckage and information from the Chinese military's procurement platform, the U.S. government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon had a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army and was a supplier approved by the Chinese military.

Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Zedong said at a press conference on Friday that China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position on the accident of a Chinese drone entering U.S. airspace by force majeure.
According to the Foreign Ministry website, she added that the relevant resolutions of the U.S. Congress are purely political manipulation and speculation.
The Chinese side is strongly dissatisfied with this and strongly opposes it.

Matthew Axelrod, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Export Enforcement, said, "Today's action demonstrates our joint efforts to identify and prevent China's use of ballistic missiles that violate the airspace of the United States and more than 40 other countries."

When they were all rescued, there was cheering in the crowd.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaraş, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man were also successfully rescued in harsh weather conditions.

The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The Chilean earthquake (1960)
On May 22, 1960, at 3:11 p.m. local time, the largest earthquake ever recorded in human history occurred in the Chilean island of Valdivia, with a magnitude of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, the entire city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The earthquake triggered a huge tsunami that hit the Chilean coastline, lifting waves up to 25 meters high.
The waves reach as far as Japan, the Philippines, and the United States.
The number of victims and economic losses caused by such a disaster cannot be accurately estimated.
The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The great earthquake of Alaska (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, also known as the Day of the Lord's Passion.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history occurred in Alaska, with a magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake remained the third largest earthquake on record in the world.
At the time of the earthquake, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke off near Prince William Bay near College Bay.
In most areas, the earthquake lasted from 3 to 5 minutes.
The shift in the sea floor caused a huge sea urchin, with a height of 67 meters.
Since it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake resulted in the death of 139 people.
Nine of them died directly from the earthquake, while another 130 died from the tsunami.
The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The Great Tangshan Earthquake of 1976
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or greater occurred in 16 hours in Tangshan City and Funan County, Hebei Province, China.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers above the ground.
The entire city of Tangshan was cut off from traffic, communications, water, and electricity, and the area was razed to the ground.
The capital, Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt a strong tremor.
According to official statistics, all affected areas, including Beijing and Tianjin, were affected by the earthquake, with 242,769 deaths and 16,4851 serious injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in China to date, after the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
But overseas scientists estimate that the earthquake could have killed at least 650,000 people.
The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The Great Indian Ocean Earthquake of 2004
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred 160 kilometers off the west coast of the Indonesian island of Sumatra, with a magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3 on the Richter scale.
The earthquake triggered waves as high as 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst affected areas including Indonesia's Zhejiang Province, Thailand's Zhejiang and Phuket Island resorts, Sri Lanka and India's Tamil Nadu.

During the peak of the tourist season, the affected area gathered a large number of tourists and local residents, which led to many tourists enjoying their holidays on the beach and local people working on the beach being swept to the bottom of the sea, making many people missing in the earthquake.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people have been killed and are missing.
The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The Great Wenchuan Earthquake of 2008
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in the Wenchuan region of Sichuan Province, China.
According to the China Earthquake Bureau, the earthquake had a magnitude of 8.2 and a magnitude of 8.3, with damage of more than 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had caused a total of 69,227 casualties, 17,923 people were missing, 374,643 people were injured to varying degrees, 19,303,000 people lost their homes, and the total population of the disaster was 4,625.6 million.
It was the most destructive earthquake since the founding of the People's Republic of China, and the deadliest after the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day each year, to increase public education and attention to disaster prevention and reduction.
Later, many governments and primary and secondary schools in China held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and secondary schools have also begun to focus on universal earthquake prevention and disaster reduction education.
The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The earthquake in Haiti (2010)
On January 12, 2010, an earthquake of magnitude 7.0 occurred in the Caribbean island nation of Haiti.
The earthquake was located 25 kilometers southwest of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, and the epicenter was about 13 kilometers above the surface.
The International Committee of the Red Cross estimates that the earthquake affected about 3 million people.
The Haitian government announced that the confirmed death toll was over 200,000.
In some parts of Haiti, up to 90% of the houses were destroyed in the earthquake.

Despite the tremendous aid and support provided by the international community, this country, which is characterized by overpopulation and widespread corruption, has never recovered from this disaster.
The most destructive earthquake in 60 years
The Great East Japan Earthquake of 2011
On March 11, 2011, a large earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 occurred off the coast of northeastern Japan.
The quake was centered in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and had a depth of 24 kilometers, causing a maximum magnitude of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake is the first earthquake of magnitude 9 or greater ever recorded in Japan.
About 22,000 people were killed in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by an earthquake and a leak.
This accident is classified as the most serious level 7 in the International Nuclear Incident Classification (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident led to the worldwide measurement of trace amounts of radioactive material, including iodine-131-137 (half-life 30 years) in the atmosphere.
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people are in urgent need of food in the two affected areas of Syria and Turkey.
In Syria alone, as many as 5.3 million people have lost their homes to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) is appealing for $7.7 million to provide food for people displaced by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the affected area is currently below freezing, and many residents are homeless.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies are still difficult to reach many people in need.
In Syria, which has been mired in a 12-year civil war, the earthquake has exacerbated the plight of the people.
In the four days after the earthquake, the World Food Program has provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) has sent 72 doses of medicines for trauma treatment and emergency surgery.
(Reuters and other sources)

Singapore's tourism industry is booming, with arrivals up 19 times from 2021

The Singapore Tourism Board (SBS) has announced that it expects international tourists to visit Singapore in 2023 to reach 12 million to 14 million, bringing in about 18 billion to 21 billion yuan in tourism revenue, and tourism revenues to recover to the pre-corona level of about 67 percent to 75 percent.
Singapore's tourism market is gradually being restored and revived in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of incoming tourists increased by 19 times from 33.06 million in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the Tourism Board's earlier estimate of 4 to 6 million, and tourists have recovered to the pre-epidemic level of 33%.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion yuan, and it is expected that the full-year tourism revenue for 2022 will be between 13.8 and 14.3 billion yuan, an increase of 6 to 7 times compared to 1.89 billion yuan in 2021, and has recovered to the level of about 50% to 52% before the coronavirus outbreak in 2019.
Singapore government takes steps to accelerate tourism recovery
In April 2022, the government announced a grant of nearly 500 million yuan to stimulate the tourism industry.
The Tourism Board recently announced that it plans to allocate 110 million yuan from this budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists.

In order to make healthy eating one of Singapore's tourist highlights, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an initiative on November 23, 2022, to develop a healthy eating attraction on Singapore's southern coast.

Wang Lingli, Executive Director of Sports and Wellness Tourism at the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health at the forefront of their considerations.

The development of a healthy livelihood attraction in Hainan District, which owns the Hainan Beach Garden, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy, allowing tourists to consume and stay longer in Singapore.
Singapore Tourism Board Director Chen Jianlong said that in the coming years, healthy eating will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products.
The coronavirus outbreak has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
To this end, the Tourism Board has been promoting healthy eating projects to the local public and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held its first Healthy Nutrition Festival, offering more than 130 health activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences to tourists.

In addition to the opening of the Singapore Children's Museum, the Avatar World in the Bay Garden, the Central Beach Market in Santa Rosa, the newly added Explore New Territories exhibition hall at the Museum of Arts and Sciences, and the newly built outdoor theater at the Night Wildlife Park, the Tourism Bureau will support the development and renovation of projects such as the World Wildlife Park to make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will set standards for the sustainable development of the tourism industry by 2023, focusing on improving waste management and carbon emissions, and further optimizing the tourism environment.
Singapore's tourism recovery accelerated by the recovery of aviation

The data shows that as of December 18, 2020, the passenger traffic at Zhangjiakou Airport has recovered strongly, with more than 150,000 passengers received per day and about 1 million passengers per week, equivalent to about 75% before the coronavirus outbreak, and the number of aviation employees has also recovered to about 90% before the outbreak.

The data shows that Singapore has received 23.6 million passengers between January and October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% before the coronavirus outbreak, and 170,000 takeoffs and landings, which is 53% before the outbreak.
The rapid recovery of tourism has also led to a recovery in the residential, transportation, catering and shopping sectors.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

According to a survey by the China Travel Platform, Singapore is among the top three countries in the world in terms of safety, which is one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the outbreak of the new coronavirus, about 3.6 million people traveled to Singapore for holidays every year.
With China's border easing policy, it is expected that Chinese tourism will recover from 30% to 60% this year to 2019.
In the future, the Tourism Bureau will pay close attention to China's further release of signals on outbound travel policy to respond to changing tourist demand, Kudan pointed out.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms such as Travel Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in view of the new trends in travel abroad.

Looking ahead to the 2023 tourism market, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the global economy will recover faster than expected as long as there is no significant recession affecting public revenues and no new large-scale deadly outbreaks.

How does Yang Yang respond to the US non-farm employment data in January that exceeded expectations and future trends?
Q: How do you see the U.S. non-farm employment data in January exceeding expectations and future trends?

The U.S. Department of Labor released non-farm employment data for January 2023 with new non-farm employment of 5.17 million, significantly higher than the market expectation of 18.9 million; unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; hourly wage growth of 4.4% year-on-year, 0.3% year-on-year, slightly relaxed.

The data is based on a number of one-off and technical factors, such as the statistical correction of the statistical caliber of the teachers who returned to the strike, the update of the seasonal adjustment factor, which may be corrected in the future (see January 2022 new non-agricultural from 50.4 million to 36.4 million), and the non-agricultural employment is not as strong as the data shows.

Structurally, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises remains, but the share is relatively low; new jobs such as high-contact services such as leisure hotels, education and healthcare have risen sharply, and data shows that the labor shortage in the service sector remains.

With the contracts far exceeding expectations, the recovery of the service industry's PMI job vacancies and labor shortages, and the strength of consumer credit data, we judge that after extreme weather and holidays, the U.S. service industry has seen a rapid recovery.
We believe that the supply and demand tensions in the U.S. job market will not improve without a recession.
The U.S. labor market is still short of more than half a million people, and labor participation is slowly rising, especially among those aged 25 to 54, who are approaching pre-pandemic highs.
In addition, the strength of excess savings and consumer credit among U.S. residents and the strength of consumer demand will push the impact of austerity on the job market further.
The continued tightness of supply and demand in the U.S. job market will be the backbone of the U.S. economy in 2023.
With interest rate hikes coming to an end, the forecast for the general strike is repeating itself, and we are not optimistic about the continuing decline in the rate of wage growth.
Before the release of this data, the U.S. stock market was overly optimistic about the Fed's path to raise interest rates.

With the continuous improvement of the Fed's data, the Fed is continuing to maintain the fragile balance of the market's expectations while shortening the pace of interest rate hikes, but the market is blind to the Fed's hawkish statements, not only anticipating an early stop to interest rate hikes, but also anticipating two interest rate cuts at the end of the year.

In the context of tight supply and demand in the labor market and unclear impact of austerity policies, we believe that the Fed's guidance for interest rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable, and the extreme adjustment of the market forecast and the congestion of trading will inevitably harm the market.

Despite this, the hardness of the wage growth rate is difficult to change the current trend of rapid decline of the general inflation, with the M2 data being negative year-on-year and the gradual improvement of the leading indicators of the various CPI sub-indices, since October, the US CPI data has shifted to the rapid decline stage, the slight hardness of the wage growth rate will form a foundation for the future general inflation data, the current market forecast is difficult to falsify, the market after the announcement of the general inflation data.
The founder of Sugi, Zheng Yongkang, who died of a sudden heart attack, led the first transformation of China's clothing industry.

On February 11, 2020, the WeChat public number of the certified entity as Sugihara Holdings Limited (hereinafter abbreviated as Sugihara Holdings) announced that Sugihara's founder and chairman of the Board of Directors, Sugihara Holdings, Zheng Yongkang, had died of a sudden heart attack on February 10, 2023.

In the 1980s, Zheng Yongkang served as the head of the State Cotton Factory, and after his appointment, Zheng Yongkang became the head of the Ningbo Yun Port Clothing General Factory, the predecessor of the Sugihara Share, in 1989.

In December 2020, at the 20th China Entrepreneurship Leaders Annual Meeting and the 22nd China Entrepreneurship Future Star Annual Meeting, Yang Yongkang said in his speech that in the Chinese western clothing market in the 1990s, the market share of the Sengshui brand was as high as 37%.

In the midst of the fashion business, the Sugi Group began to transform, because Zheng Yongkang realized that once the market was open, Chinese brands would naturally form a ladder-like brand market, and Sugi Xi wanted to dominate the market, and the possibility of becoming a nationalist in the long run was not great.

In 1999, Sugiyama began to study corporate transformation, and in the same year, Yang Yongkang recalled, "We came to Shanghai to find out what transformation is all about, and we found a lot of experts and scholars, and we held a series of competitive conferences and virtual conferences".
Finally, we set two big strategic directions.
The first direction is new energy and new materials, the other is a great health and future.

In 2001, Sugisaki shares implemented the scale production of the medium-sized carbon microball, and began domestic production as an alternative, replacing Japan as the main supplier of the medium-sized carbon microball in the country.
It is the first lithium-ion battery negative material production company in China, which has implemented the national production of lithium-ion battery negative material.

As the use of lithium batteries became more widespread, the lithium battery business of the company gradually developed, and in 2007 the lithium electric materials business was written into the main business of the company, while the revenue of the clothing business decreased year by year, until 2013, the revenue of the lithium electric materials business of the company completely exceeded the clothing business.

In February 2021, Sugiwara Corporation successfully acquired LG's chemical polarization business, advancing the LCD polarization market, and merged Sugiwara's polarization company with Golden Light Electric, a relatively high-tech company in the field. Because everyone will consider that I spent so much money, I have to send someone to take care of it, this is a behavior that is usually done, but Zheng Yongkang is different, on the day of the success of the acquisition of Zheng Yongkang, Zheng Yongkang announced to the Zheng Jing Guo Electricity Company that Zheng Jing was the largest shareholder, decided to implement a two-pronged system, except for Zheng Yongkang as chairman, Zheng Yongkang's company did not send Zheng Jing to take over the authorization of the operation.

On February 10, the Securities and Exchange Commission announced that the E-Fund account app will be launched in mobile app stores and launched for public trial.

The fund's one-stop inquiry service, which provides private investors with information on the accounts and shares of publicly traded funds, is designed to solve the pain points of industry services such as forgotten accounts and inquiries for large and small investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 public fund managers in the country, managing funds of about 26 trillion yuan; 167 public fund registration agencies, and 411 public fund sales agencies.
The various registries are independent of each other and lack a unified channel of inquiry.
According to industry insiders, by the end of 2021, more than 720 million people had invested in our fund, which means that half of the people in the country had invested in fund products.

Previously, investors needed to inquire about purchases through different sales agencies, and through the fund's E-account, they could inquire about purchases through all sales channels, and hold the fund's status in a flash.
What is the E-funding app?

According to the relevant documents, the fund's E-Account app is a mobile application for the Chinese public fund industry that has been approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission for development and construction, and provides investors with a one-stop-shop to inquire about the out-of-the-box holdings of public fund products.

Investors can easily and quickly master the holdings of their out-of-the-box shares of publicly traded fund products owned by fund managers who purchase through various sales channels throughout the market through the fund's E-account, to fully improve the efficiency of inquiries.

In particular, investors can access information through the fund's E-Account, which includes information on fund accounts opened by public fund managers across the market, information on trading accounts opened by public fund sales agencies, and the number of investors holding products such as publicly traded securities investment funds and securities companies that are not limited to 200 people.

Liu Yicheng, business manager of the Shanghai Securities Fund Rating Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can find out about the holdings of all their out-of-the-money publicly traded funds through the fund's E-Account app, which helps them recover forgotten assets, and more importantly, the collection of all the information about the investment situation of the client's fund, which helps them to better optimize their fund combination and better plan their financial arrangements.
How to register?

The report noted that the fund's E-Account app is currently available in mobile app stores such as Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and Vivo, but the app is still in the public trial phase, and registration requires filling in an invitation code, and investors can contact the fund's manager to get it.

A large public fund in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to the Economic Observer network reporter, and told the reporter that during the trial phase of the app, China will provide a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, and investors will call to get them.
After the end of the trial run, there is no need to invite a code when registering as an open user.
What's wrong?

According to the press release of the official website of the Securities and Exchange Commission, the fund's e-account has been downloaded and the relevant documents have been used to register the account and complete the inquiry, the entire process takes only a few minutes, mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real name certificate, fund account, public fund inquiry.

After passing this step of authentication, clicking on the "Asset Fund" button, all fund products purchased through the fund's sales platforms are displayed in the list of options (you can select the account), and after completing the selection, you can intuitively see the total assets of the fund and start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the fund's e-mail account only provides inquiry services to investors and cannot make bids.
The data date displayed by the <unk>Fund E <unk>Account<unk> is usually the date on which the user made the query (T day) pushed forward by three trading days <unk>

For example, if you open the fund's E account on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net worth displayed on the asset page are pushed forward by three trading days to the corresponding date, i.e. February 7.

East Germany's last Communist Party Prime Minister dies today
The party's successor, the East German Communist Party, said in a statement: "Last night, Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95.
As a result, our party lost an important leader.
What's wrong?
On November 13, 1989, four days after the opening of the Berlin Wall, which separated East and West Berlin for 28 years, Moderato said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At that time, the Communist Party leaders were forced to step down due to protests across East Germany demanding democracy and freedom.
Mikhail Gorbachev, after taking office in the Soviet Union, demanded changes in Soviet-led Eastern Europe as well.
In March 1990, Modrow declared the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election result led to him no longer serving as Prime Minister.
Despite the reforms, Modarotti was accused by opponents of trying to delay the political transition and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modro was convicted of electoral fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but was not imprisoned.
The allegations are said to be politically motivated.
Modrow continued to serve in the German Parliament from 1990 to 1994, and as a Member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modrow sees himself as a reformer and wants to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want the old East Germany to return, but said he should acknowledge East Germany's achievements.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica, Poland), and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he served as a platoon leader in the Youth Fire Brigade, and near the end of the conflict became a member of the Nazi militia organization Volkssturm, which recruited men between the ages of 16 and 60 to fight in the last war.
At the age of 17, Modro was captured by the Soviet army and taken as a prisoner of war to the Soviet Union, where he attended an anti-fascist course and became a staunch Communist Party member.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found a job as a mechanic, and continued to study social science and economics, earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a member of the staff of the Free German Youth Movement, which included almost all East German youth, and was promoted to chairman of the Dresden Regional Party by the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) from 1973 to 1989.
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, serving as the highest national office.
